app.cards.game

Class HandResult

  • java.lang.Object
    • app.cards.game.HandResult
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<HandResult>

    public class HandResult
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<HandResult>
    Encapsulates the result of the evaluation of a Hand initiated by calling Hand.evaluate().

    • Constructor Detail

      • HandResult

        HandResult(HandType handType,
          java.util.List<HandValue> breakdown,
          java.lang.String id)
        Creates a new HandResult with the supplied information
        Parameters:
        handType - which HandType was identified for the Cards of a Hand
        breakdown - how the best 5-card combination breaks down into HandValues, from best to worst
        id - the identifier for this HandResult (see Hand.setId(String))

    • Method Detail

      • getHandType

        public HandType getHandType()

        Returns:
        The HandType represented by this HandResult

      • getBreakdown

        public java.util.List<HandValue> getBreakdown()

        A detailed breakdown of all HandValues producing the HandType represented by this HandResult

        The total number of Cards across all these HandValues is guaranteed to equal 5. In case the actual HandType consists of less than five cards (High card, One Pair, Two Pair, Three of a kind, Four of a kind), the returned breakdown will be filled the best of the remaining Cards. The order inside the returned List is guaranteed to be best to worst, e. g. a two-pair Hand will break down as an NOfAKind with 2 Cards representing the better pair, another NOfAKind with the worse pair, plus the "best of the rest" Card to make up the numbers.

        Returns:
        The breakdown as a List of HandValues comprising the determined HandType.

      • getId

        public java.lang.String getId()

        The ID of this HandResult

        The Hand object that has created this HandResult will pass its ID into it upon calling the constructor. This enables for tracking down the Hand which produced this HandResult.

        Returns:
        The ID of this HandResult

      • fillBreakdownWithBestUnusedCardsFrom

        void fillBreakdownWithBestUnusedCardsFrom(java.util.Set<Card> cards)
        Puts the best Cards from the supplied Set into the breakdown until it contains exactly 5 Cards
        Parameters:
        cards - a Set from which to pick the best Cards (as determined by the RankBeforeSuitComparator) until a total of 5 Cards is in the breakdown

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a human-readable explanation of this HandResult
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A human-readble String containing the HandType and breakdown of this HandResult

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(HandResult other)

        Compares this HandResult to another

        Whether one HandResult is better than another is determined by the usual poker hand ranking (see also HandType, specifically HandType.getValue()).

        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<HandResult>
        Returns:
        A negative number if this HandResult is better than other, a positive number if other is better than this HandResult, 0 if they're equal
